info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 20 at 10:32AM CDT until July 20 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MASSAC...SOUTHEASTERN POPE...SOUTHWESTERN LIVINGSTON...NORTHWESTERN MARSHALL...SOUTHEASTERN MCCRACKEN AND NORTHEASTERN GRAVES COUNTIES... At 1031 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Paducah, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Paducah, Lone Oak, Reidland, Brookport, Ledbetter, Hamletsburg and Symsonia. This includes Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 4 and 19. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
